instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2915: What is 820-2915? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.820-2914: What is 820-2914? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.CHGR_BMON: What is CHGR_BMON? CHGR_BMON goes between the ISL6259, ISL9239, or ISL9240 that charges the battery & creates PPBUS_G3H and the SMC(system management controller) or T2 chip(on machines where the SMC is integrated into the T2 chip) and provides current sensing information on battery charging to the SMC. If diagnostics reveal an off reading or failure with the charger current sense, this is a good place to start troubleshooting..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, slow battery charging
threads.message:
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B, it has some issue with charging,
when I plug the MagSafe it charges the battery consuming 2.9A directly after it decreases the amper consumption to 1.2A
I think it has an issue with the Amperomter sensor after it charges the battery slowly.

<CHIP>U7000</CHIP> replaced
battery SDA/SCL 0.530 diode mode/ 3.4V


who to start this troubleshooting?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, slow battery charging
threads.message:
Is your board 2914, or 2915?
Did you try known good battery?
Original Magsafe 1 85W charger?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, slow battery charging
threads.message: I'm not an expert, but from my experience this is usually caused by a bad aftermarket battery. Change <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> and <TRANSISTOR>Q7055</TRANSISTOR> at once and never connect that bad battery again.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, slow battery charging
threads.message:
Sorry for being late on this..
it is 2915
Resistance between pin 19/20 9.2omh
27/28 26ohm

I didn't replace <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>, it is a new board but it has the same issue.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, slow battery charging
threads.message: Try KNOWN GOOD battery, as you can waste time for nothing...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, slow battery charging
threads.message: I tested a good battery the same problem, it charge the battery with 0.5amp

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, slow battery charging
threads.message:
When battery voltage increases, charging current decreases, this is normal behaviour.
Can you fully charge the battery?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, slow battery charging
threads.message:
the battery voltage 10.8v
it shows on the system 8%

I put this battery on other known good board it charges with 2.5amp.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, slow battery charging
threads.message:
For such low level yes, should charge with high current.
I was thinking you had battery almost full...

Check <SIGNAL>SMC_DCIN</SIGNAL>/<SIGNAL>BMON_ISENSE</SIGNAL> levels.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, slow battery charging
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>SMC_DCIN_ISENSE</SIGNAL> 0.3v oscillate to 1v
<SIGNAL>BMON_ISENSE</SIGNAL> 3v

the battery level about 50%

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, slow battery charging
threads.message:
"<SIGNAL>BMON_ISENSE</SIGNAL> 3v"
There is your problem!

Post <SIGNAL>CHGR_BMON</SIGNAL> level and check resistance between pins 17/18 of <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, slow battery charging
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, slow battery charging
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, slow battery charging
threads.message: 100% <TRANSISTOR>Q7055</TRANSISTOR>, you will find it is shorted right now.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, slow battery charging
threads.message:
Yes I found a broken trace on the <RESISTOR>R5422</RESISTOR> and I repaired it 
<TRANSISTOR>Q7055</TRANSISTOR> replaced also but I didn't found a short in it
thanks for help
